recipes.name: Indian Tandoori Chicken Salad with Mango Dressing
ingredients: 1/2 pound boneless, skinless Chicken breasts, cut into 1-inch cubes
2 tablespoons Ginger-Garlic Paste (1-inch ginger grated + 3 cloves garlic, grated)
2 ripe Mangoes, pureed (or 1/2 cup thawed frozen Mango puree)
Salt and freshly ground Black Pepper, to taste
1 tablespoon Sugar (optional, if mango is not sweet)
directions: Step 1: Prepare the Spiced Cashews: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C). In a bowl, combine cashews, 1 tablespoon canola oil, 1 tablespoon curry powder, 2 tablespoons lime juice, salt, and black pepper. Spread on a baking sheet and roast for 10 minutes, or until golden brown and fragrant.

Step 2: Marinate the Chicken: In a medium bowl, combine 3 tablespoons yogurt, thyme (or ajwain), garam masala, cumin, 1/2 teaspoon salt, paprika, 1 tablespoon lime juice, orange food coloring, and ginger-garlic paste. Add the cubed chicken and toss to coat thoroughly.
Step 3: Refrigerate Chicken: Cover the bowl and refrigerate for at least 1 hour, or preferably overnight.

Step 4: Grill or Broil the Chicken: Preheat grill to high heat or preheat broiler. Thread chicken onto skewers. Grill for 10-12 minutes, turning once halfway through, until charred and cooked through. Alternatively, broil for 16 minutes, turning once halfway through.

Step 5: Make the Mango Dressing: In a food processor or blender, combine 1/4 cup yogurt, mango puree, 2 tablespoons lime juice, and sugar (if using). Blend until smooth. Add 1-2 tablespoons of water if needed to thin the dressing. Season with salt to taste.
Step 6: Assemble the Salad: In a large bowl, combine romaine lettuce, baby romaine, sliced cucumber, and sliced radishes. Top with grilled or broiled chicken and spiced cashews.
Step 7: Serve: Serve the mango dressing on the side or pour over the salad just before serving.

Include a small bowl of vibrant mango dressing alongside.  Lighting should be soft and directional, emphasizing the salad's freshness.

scenes.voice_over: Combine the cashews with oil, curry powder, lime juice, salt and pepper. Spread them on a baking sheet and roast at 400°F (200°C) for 10 minutes, or until golden brown.

scenes.voice_over: Let's make the mango dressing.  We'll combine mango puree, yogurt, lime juice, and a touch of sugar if your mango isn't sweet enough.

cooking_tips: For a smokier flavor, grill the chicken over charcoal. If using wooden skewers, soak them in water for 30 minutes before grilling to prevent burning.

recipes.name: Oven-Baked Tandoori Chicken
ingredients: 1 large clove garlic, or 3-4 small Indian garlic cloves, minced
directions: Step 1: Marinate the Chicken: In a blender, combine the yogurt, cubed onion, minced garlic, grated ginger, chili powder, lime juice, garam masala, salt, and red food coloring (if using). Blend until smooth.
Step 2: Prepare the Chicken: Clean the chicken legs and make deep slits into the flesh, reaching the bone. This helps the marinade penetrate.

Step 3: Marinate: Place the chicken in a large ziplock bag or bowl. Pour the marinade over the chicken, ensuring it's well coated. Marinate for at least 8 hours, or preferably overnight, in the refrigerator.
Step 4: Preheat and Prepare: Preheat oven to 450°F (230°C). Line a baking sheet with aluminum foil and grease with oil.

Step 5: Bake: Arrange the chicken pieces on the prepared baking sheet, ensuring they don't touch. Avoid excess marinade on the sheet. Bake for 15-20 minutes, or until cooked through and slightly charred.
Step 6: Serve: Serve hot with lime wedges, green chutney, and raw onion slices.

scenes.voice_over: Place the chicken in a ziplock bag, pour in the marinade, and make sure each piece is thoroughly coated. Marinate for at least 8 hours, or better yet, overnight.

cooking_tips: For a smokier flavor, you can char the chicken under a broiler for the last few minutes of cooking.

recipes.name: Chicken Makhani (Indian Butter Chicken)
ingredients: 1 lb boneless, skinless chicken thighs, cut into bite-size pieces
Salt and black pepper to taste
directions: Step 1: Prepare the rice according to package directions.
Step 2: Heat the vegetable oil or canola oil in a large pot or Dutch oven over medium-high heat. Add the chicken and cook until lightly browned.
Step 3: Add the chopped onion and a pinch of salt to the pot. Cook, stirring occasionally, until the onion is softened, about 5-7 minutes.
Step 4: Add the grated ginger and minced garlic to the pot. Stir and cook for 2 minutes more.
Step 5: Add the garam masala, chili powder, ground cumin, and ground red pepper to the pot. Stir and cook for another 2 minutes, allowing the spices to toast.
Step 6: Stir in the tomato sauce, sour cream or evaporated milk, butter or Butter Buds, lemon juice, and bay leaf. Bring the mixture to a boil.
Step 7: Reduce the heat to low, cover, and simmer for 20 minutes, or until the chicken is cooked through and the sauce has thickened.
Step 8: Remove the bay leaf.  Stir in the cooked rice.
Step 9: Season with salt and black pepper to taste.
Step 10: Serve hot, garnished with chopped scallions or cilantro, if desired.

recipes.name: Chicken Makhani (Indian Butter Chicken)
ingredients: 1/4 teaspoon cayenne pepper, or to taste
1 pound boneless, skinless chicken thighs, cut into bite-sized pieces
directions: Step 1: Heat 1 tablespoon of peanut oil in a large saucepan over medium-high heat. Sauté the shallot and onion until softened and translucent.
Step 2: Add the butter, lemon juice, ginger-garlic paste, 1 teaspoon of garam masala, chili powder, cumin, and bay leaf. Cook, stirring, for 1 minute.
Step 3: Add the tomato puree and cook for 2 minutes, stirring frequently.
Step 4: Stir in the half-and-half and yogurt. Reduce heat to low and simmer for 10 minutes, stirring frequently.
Step 5: Season with salt, pepper, and cayenne pepper to taste. Remove from heat and set aside.
Step 6: Heat 1 tablespoon of peanut oil in a large, heavy skillet over medium heat. Cook the chicken until lightly browned, about 10 minutes.
Step 7: Reduce heat and season the chicken with 1 teaspoon of garam masala and cayenne pepper.
Step 8: Stir in about 1/3 of the sauce and simmer until the liquid has reduced and the chicken is cooked through, about 5 minutes.
Step 9: Pour the rest of the sauce into the skillet with the chicken.
Step 10: In a small bowl, whisk together the cornstarch and water until smooth. Stir the cornstarch mixture into the sauce.
Step 11: Cook for 5 to 10 minutes, or until the sauce has thickened.

recipes.name: Ultimate Baked Chicken
directions: Step 1: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
Step 2: Rinse the chicken and pat it dry. Place it in a roasting pan or a 9x13 inch baking dish.
Step 3: In a microwave-safe bowl or small saucepan, combine the Italian dressing, soy sauce, Worcestershire sauce, and butter. Heat until the butter is melted and the mixture is well combined.
Step 4: Pour the marinade over the chicken, ensuring it's coated thoroughly, inside and out.
Step 5: Sprinkle the top and sides of the chicken with poultry seasoning, salt, pepper, basil, and garlic powder.
Step 6: Place the bay leaves inside the cavity of the chicken.
Step 7: Bake for 30 minutes, then baste the chicken with pan juices.
Step 8: Bake for another 30 minutes.
Step 9: Remove the chicken from the oven and turn it over.
Step 10: Baste the exposed underside with pan juices and season with poultry seasoning, pepper, and basil.
Step 11: Return the chicken to the oven and bake for another 30 minutes.
Step 12: Turn the chicken over again and bake for a final 15-30 minutes, or until the juices run clear when the thigh is pierced with a fork.
Step 13: Let the chicken rest for 10-15 minutes before carving and serving. Spoon pan juices over each serving.

recipes.name: Indian Butter Chicken
ingredients: 1 pound boneless, skinless chicken thighs, cut into 2-inch cubes
2 tablespoons ginger-garlic paste (or 1-inch piece of ginger, grated, and 4 cloves garlic, minced)
1 small red onion, thinly sliced into half-moons
directions: Step 1: In a large bowl, combine the ginger-garlic paste, diced tomatoes, tomato paste, ground almonds, garam masala, cumin, salt, cayenne pepper (or chili powder).
Step 2: Add the beaten yogurt to the spice mixture and mix well.
Step 3: Add the cubed chicken to the marinade, ensuring it's coated evenly. Cover the bowl and refrigerate for at least 1 hour, or preferably longer.
Step 4: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C).
Step 5: In a large pan or skillet, melt the butter over medium heat. Add the sliced red onions and sauté until softened and translucent, about 5 minutes.
Step 6: Add the marinated chicken to the pan and cook for 3-4 minutes, lightly browning on all sides.
Step 7: Transfer the partially cooked chicken to an 8x8 inch baking dish.
Step 8: Pour the heavy cream over the chicken and sprinkle with fresh cilantro, if desired.
Step 9: Cover the baking dish and bake for 25 minutes. Then, uncover and bake for another 5 minutes, or until the chicken is golden brown and cooked through.
Step 10: For a richer flavor, optionally broil the chicken for 1-2 minutes before serving.
Step 11: Serve hot with rice or naan bread.

recipes.name: Indian Tandoori Chicken Salad with Spiced Cashews
ingredients: 1/2 pound boneless, skinless Chicken breasts, cubed
2 tablespoons Ginger-Garlic Paste (1-inch ginger grated + 3 cloves garlic grated)
2 ripe Mangoes, pureed (or 1/2 cup thawed frozen Mango puree)
Salt and freshly ground Black Pepper, to taste
1 tablespoon Sugar (optional, if mango isn't sweet)
directions: Step 1: Prepare the Spiced Cashews: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C). In a bowl, combine cashews, 1 tablespoon canola oil, 1 tablespoon curry powder, 1-2 tablespoons lime juice, salt, and pepper. Spread on a baking sheet and roast for 10 minutes, or until fragrant and lightly browned. Set aside to cool.

Step 2: Marinate the Chicken: In a medium bowl, combine 3 tablespoons yogurt, thyme (or ajwain), garam masala, cumin, 1/2 teaspoon salt, paprika, 1 tablespoon lime juice, orange food coloring, and ginger-garlic paste. Add the cubed chicken and toss to coat thoroughly. Cover and refrigerate for at least 1 hour, or preferably overnight.

Step 3: Grill or Broil the Chicken: Preheat grill to high heat or preheat broiler. Thread marinated chicken onto skewers. Grill for 10-12 minutes, turning halfway through, or until charred and cooked through. Alternatively, broil for 16 minutes, turning halfway through, until charred and cooked through.

Step 4: Make the Mango Dressing: In a food processor or blender, combine 4 tablespoons yogurt, mango puree, 2 tablespoons lime juice, zest of 1/2 lime, and optional sugar. Blend until smooth. Add 1-2 tablespoons of water if needed to thin the consistency. Season with salt to taste.

Step 5: Assemble the Salad: In a large salad bowl, combine chopped romaine lettuce, baby romaine, sliced cucumbers, and sliced radishes. Top with grilled or broiled chicken and spiced cashews. Serve the mango dressing on the side or pour over the salad just before serving.

Style the chopped romaine and baby romaine base artfully, showcasing the colorful sliced cucumbers, radishes, and tandoori-marinated chicken.  Garnish with chopped cilantro and whole spiced cashews. Use a slightly overhead, angled shot with shallow depth of field, focusing on the chicken. Bright, natural light should highlight the textures and create a fresh, inviting mood. Incorporate rustic wooden elements and textured linens for a warm, earthy backdrop.

video_script.title: Indian Tandoori Chicken Salad with Spiced Cashews

scenes.image_prompt: Show all ingredients neatly arranged. Group similar items together. Show yogurt, spices, chicken. Group mangoes, lime, yogurt for dressing. Show cashews, curry powder, and lime for garnish. Show lettuces, cucumber, radishes.
scenes.voice_over: Here's what you'll need for this vibrant salad.  For the chicken, we have chicken breasts, yogurt, ginger-garlic paste, spices like garam masala and cumin, and some lime juice.  For the mango dressing, we'll use fresh mangoes, yogurt, lime, and a touch of sugar if needed. Finally, for the spiced cashews: cashews, curry powder, and lime juice. Of course, we'll also need fresh romaine lettuce, cucumber, and radishes for the salad itself.

scenes.image_prompt: Cashews being tossed in a bowl with oil, curry powder, lime juice, salt, and pepper. Then spread on a baking sheet.
scenes.voice_over: First, preheat your oven to 400°F (200°C). Combine the cashews with canola oil, curry powder, lime juice, salt, and pepper. Spread them on a baking sheet.

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up of the cashews baking in the oven, turning golden brown.
scenes.voice_over: Roast for about 10 minutes, or until fragrant and lightly browned. Keep an eye on them so they don't burn. Set aside to cool.

scenes.image_prompt: Cubed chicken being marinated in a bowl with yogurt, spices, and ginger-garlic paste.
scenes.voice_over: In a bowl, combine yogurt, thyme or ajwain, garam masala, ground cumin, salt, paprika, lime juice, orange food coloring, and ginger-garlic paste.  Add the cubed chicken and mix well. Marinate for at least an hour, or preferably overnight.

scenes.image_prompt: Chicken skewers being grilled, with flames and smoke visible in the background. Close-up on the chicken getting char marks.
scenes.voice_over: Preheat your grill to high heat. Thread the marinated chicken onto skewers. Grill for 10-12 minutes, turning halfway through, until cooked through and nicely charred.

scenes.image_prompt: Mango, yogurt, lime juice, and zest being blended in a food processor until smooth.
scenes.voice_over: While the chicken grills, make the dressing. Combine mango puree, yogurt, lime juice, and lime zest in a blender. Blend until smooth. Add a bit of water if needed to thin it out.

scenes.image_prompt: A large bowl with chopped romaine lettuce, cucumber, and radish slices. Grilled chicken and spiced cashews are being added on top.
scenes.voice_over: In a large bowl, combine chopped romaine lettuce, baby romaine, cucumber slices, and radish slices.  Top with the grilled chicken and spiced cashews.

scenes.image_prompt: Final shot of the Indian Tandoori Chicken Salad with the mango dressing drizzled on top. A serving spoon is placed next to the salad bowl.
scenes.voice_over: Serve the mango dressing on the side or drizzle it over the salad. Enjoy your delicious and healthy Indian Tandoori Chicken Salad!

cooking_tips: If using wooden skewers, soak them in water for at least 30 minutes before grilling to prevent burning.
Adjust the amount of garam masala and paprika to control the spice level.
For a smoother dressing, strain the mango puree before blending.

recipes.name: Restaurant-Style Indian Butter Chicken (Murgh Makhani)
ingredients: 1 1/2 lbs boneless, skinless chicken breasts, cut into 1-inch cubes
directions: Step 1: Marinate the Chicken: In a large bowl, combine the cubed chicken, yogurt, 1 tablespoon lemon juice, 1 tablespoon chili powder, a pinch of salt, and liquid smoke (if using). Mix well and refrigerate for at least 1 hour.

If you don't have liquid smoke, you can omit it or add a pinch of smoked paprika.

recipes.name: Shahi Chicken Keema
ingredients: Fresh coriander leaves, chopped, for garnish
directions: Step 1: Marinate the minced chicken with lime juice and ginger-garlic paste. Mix well and marinate for at least 1 hour, or preferably overnight in the refrigerator.
Step 2: In a food processor, combine the marinated chicken, chopped onion, ginger, garlic, mint leaves, and coriander leaves. Pulse until finely ground. Set aside.

Step 3: Heat 1 tbsp of ghee or oil in a pan over medium heat. Add caraway seeds, cumin seeds, and fennel seeds. Once they crackle, add dried red chilies, cinnamon stick, mace, peppercorns, cloves, green cardamom, and coriander seeds. Sauté for a minute.
Step 4: Transfer the sautéed spices to a food processor and grind into a smooth paste. Set aside.
Step 5: In the same food processor, grind melon seeds, poppy seeds, almonds, and sesame seeds into a smooth paste. Add a little water if needed.
Step 6: Heat the remaining ghee or oil in a large pan or pot over medium heat. Add the ground spice paste and sauté for 2-3 minutes, or until the oil starts to separate from the paste.
Step 7: Add the ground chicken mixture to the pan. Sauté until the water evaporates and the chicken is cooked through.
Step 8: Stir in turmeric powder, cashews, garam masala, and chicken biryani masala. Mix well.
Step 9: Add milk (if using) and boiling water. Bring to a simmer and cook until the gravy thickens to your desired consistency.
Step 10: Season with salt to taste. Garnish with fresh coriander leaves and sliced boiled eggs (if using).
Step 11: Serve hot with pav or roti.

recipes.name: Indian Chicken Coconut Korma
ingredients: ½ cup Cashews, raw, plus extra for garnish
1 (13-14 ounce) can Coconut Milk, full fat
Salt and freshly ground Black Pepper, to taste
6 large Chicken Thighs, boneless and skinless
⅓ cup Golden Raisins, plus more for garnish
directions: Step 1: Soak the cashews and coconut flakes in a bowl covered with an inch of water for at least 4 hours, or preferably overnight.
Step 2: Drain the cashews and coconut flakes. Transfer to a high-speed blender and puree until a smooth paste forms.
Step 3: Add the full-fat coconut milk to the blender and puree until smooth and well combined. Set this coconut mixture aside.
Step 4: Heat the coconut oil in a large, oven-safe skillet or Dutch oven over high heat.
Step 5: Season the chicken thighs generously with salt and pepper.
Step 6: Sear the chicken thighs in the hot oil until golden brown on both sides. Remove the chicken from the pan and set aside.
Step 7: Reduce the heat to medium-high. Add the chopped onion, ground cumin, ground turmeric, garam masala, and ground ginger to the skillet.
Step 8: Sauté for 2-3 minutes, until the onion becomes translucent.
Step 9: Add the minced garlic and sauté for another 30 seconds until fragrant.
Step 10: Return the chicken thighs to the skillet. Add the golden raisins.
Step 11: Pour the chicken stock into the skillet and bring the liquid to a simmer. Cover the skillet.
Step 12: Preheat oven to 325°F (160°C).
Step 13: Transfer the covered skillet to the preheated oven and cook for 45 minutes.
Step 14: Remove the skillet from the oven and add the prepared coconut-cashew sauce. Return the skillet to the oven and cook for another 45 minutes, or until the chicken is fork-tender.
Step 15: Remove the skillet from the oven and shred the chicken lightly with two forks.
Step 16: Check the seasoning and adjust salt and pepper to taste. Garnish with fresh cilantro, extra cashews, and golden raisins. Serve hot over cooked red quinoa or other grains of your choice.

Employ warm, directional lighting to highlight the creamy texture and vibrant yellow hue of the korma against the dark backdrop. recipes.name: Indian Spiced Pounded Chicken Breast
ingredients: Freshly ground black pepper, to taste
directions: Step 1: In a small bowl, combine the ground cumin, turmeric, ground coriander, onion powder, salt, and black pepper. Set aside.

Step 2: Starting at the thicker side of each chicken breast, use a sharp knife to make a lengthwise horizontal cut into the top, stopping before cutting all the way through. Fold the chicken breast open like a book.

Step 3: Place each chicken breast between two pieces of plastic wrap. Using the flat side of a meat tenderizer, pound the chicken from the center out until it's spread to about double its original size and approximately 1/4 inch thick. Repeat for all chicken breasts.

Step 4: Remove the plastic wrap.  In the small bowl with the spices, add 1 tablespoon of olive oil and mix well to form a paste. Rub the spice paste evenly over one side of each chicken breast. Cover with plastic wrap again and lightly pound the seasoning into the chicken using the textured side of the meat tenderizer. Flip the breasts, rub the remaining spice paste onto the other side, cover with plastic wrap, and lightly pound the seasoning in.
Step 5: Heat the remaining 1 tablespoon of olive oil in a large skillet over high heat.

Step 6: Once the oil is shimmering, add one chicken breast to the skillet. Place a weight (such as a cast iron pan or tea kettle) on top of the chicken and cook for 1 minute. Flip the chicken, replace the weight, and cook for another 1 minute, or until cooked through. The cooking time may vary depending on the thickness of the chicken.
Step 7: Transfer the cooked chicken to a plate and let it rest for 3 minutes before serving. Repeat with the remaining chicken breasts.

recipes.name: Indian Roast Chicken with Green Chutney Sauce
ingredients: 6-8 large shallots, thinly sliced (or 1 red onion, thinly sliced)
directions: Step 1: Prepare the Green Chutney Marinade: Combine cilantro, mint, green chilies, garlic, salt, garam masala, and yogurt in a blender or food processor. Blend until smooth.

Step 2: Marinate the Chicken: Place the chicken thighs in a large bowl. Pour the green chutney marinade over the chicken and rub it all over, ensuring it gets under the skin as well. Cover the bowl and let it rest for at least 1 hour, or refrigerate for longer (up to 4 hours).
Step 3: Preheat and Prepare for Roasting: Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C). Remove the chicken from the refrigerator 30 minutes before roasting to allow it to come to room temperature.

Step 4: Arrange and Roast: In a roasting pan or oven-safe skillet, arrange the sliced shallots (or red onion) and diced potatoes at the bottom. Shake off any excess marinade from the chicken thighs and place them on top of the vegetables, skin-side down.

Step 5: Bake: Roast for 30 minutes, basting with pan juices halfway through. Flip the chicken thighs skin-side up and continue baking for another 15-20 minutes, or until the juices run clear and the internal temperature reaches 165°F (74°C). Broil for 1-2 minutes at the end to crisp the skin.

Step 6: Make the Pan Gravy: Remove the chicken and potatoes from the roasting pan and set aside. If your pan is stovetop safe, make the gravy directly in it. Otherwise, transfer the pan juices and shallots to a skillet.
Step 7: Thicken the Gravy: In a small bowl, whisk together the cornstarch and 1/2 cup of water or stock until smooth. Set aside.
Step 8: Deglaze and Simmer: Add butter to the pan juices and melt over medium heat, scraping up any browned bits from the bottom of the pan. Pour in 1 cup of water or stock and bring to a simmer.

Step 9: Finish the Gravy: Whisk in the cornstarch slurry and cook for 2-3 minutes, stirring constantly, until the gravy thickens. Season with salt and pepper to taste. You can either strain the gravy to remove the shallot pieces or blend everything together for a smoother sauce.
Step 10: Serve: Serve the roast chicken with the potatoes and green chutney pan gravy. Garnish with lime wedges and extra green chutney, if desired.

recipes.name: Shredded Indian-Style Chicken
ingredients: 1 cup Green Peas, frozen or fresh
directions: Step 1: In a medium-sized pot, combine the split chicken breast, 2 cups of water, and 2 teaspoons of salt. Bring to a boil over medium-high heat.
Step 2: Reduce heat to low, cover, and simmer for 20-30 minutes, or until the chicken is fully cooked and easily shreds. Remove the chicken from the pot and set aside to cool slightly.
Step 3: While the chicken is cooking, prepare the sauce. Melt the butter in a large pot or Dutch oven over medium heat.

Step 4: Add the diced onions and crushed garlic to the pot and cook until softened and fragrant, about 5 minutes.  Then, add the garam masala, cumin, coriander, and turmeric. Cook for 1 minute more, stirring constantly, until fragrant.

Step 5: Add the tomato paste to the pot and cook, stirring constantly, for 1 minute. Then, add the tomato puree. Taste the sauce and adjust seasonings as needed, adding more garam masala for a stronger spice flavor or more tomato paste for a richer tomato flavor.

Step 6: Pour in the chicken broth and add the green peas. Bring the sauce to a simmer, then reduce heat to low and cook for 10-15 minutes, or until the sauce has thickened slightly. Stir in the heavy cream, 2 teaspoons of salt, and 1 teaspoon of black pepper.
Step 7: Shred the cooked chicken and add it to the sauce. Stir to combine and heat through. Serve hot with rice.

recipes.name: Indian Cashew Chicken
ingredients: 14 ounces skinless, boneless chicken thighs, cut into bite-sized pieces
16 ounces skinless, boneless chicken breasts, cut into bite-sized pieces
directions: Step 1: Combine cashews, yogurt, tomato paste, vinegar, garam masala, coriander, ginger, red pepper, and garlic in a blender or food processor. Process until smooth.

Step 2: Place chicken thighs and breasts in a large bowl. Add the cashew-yogurt mixture and stir to coat the chicken thoroughly. Cover the bowl and refrigerate for at least 3 hours, or preferably overnight.
Step 3: Heat a large Dutch oven or pot over medium-low heat. Coat the pan with cooking spray.
Step 4: Add chopped onion, crushed cardamom pods, and cinnamon stick to the pot. Cover and cook for 10 minutes, or until the onion is golden, stirring often.
Step 5: Add the marinated chicken mixture to the pot. Cook for 10 minutes, stirring frequently.

Step 6: Pour in chicken broth, tomato puree, paprika, and salt. Scrape the bottom of the pan to loosen any browned bits. Bring the mixture to a simmer, then reduce heat to low, cover, and cook for 1 hour, or until the sauce has thickened.
Step 7: Stir in half-and-half and cook for 1 minute, stirring occasionally.
Step 8: Remove from heat and discard the cinnamon stick. Garnish with fresh cilantro, if desired.

recipes.name: Indian Butter Chicken
ingredients: 1 lb boneless, skinless chicken thighs, cut into 2-inch cubes
2 tbsp ginger-garlic paste (or 4 cloves garlic and 1-inch ginger, grated)
1 small red onion, thinly sliced into half-moons
directions: Step 1: In a large bowl, combine the ginger-garlic paste, diced tomatoes, tomato paste, ground almonds, salt, garam masala, cayenne pepper (or chili powder), cumin powder, and cardamom pods (or powder).
Step 2: Add the beaten yogurt to the spice mixture and mix well.
Step 3: Add the cubed chicken to the marinade and coat thoroughly. Cover and refrigerate for at least 1 hour, or preferably longer.
Step 4: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C).
Step 5: Heat the butter in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the sliced red onions and sauté until softened and translucent, about 5 minutes.
Step 6: Add the marinated chicken to the skillet and cook for 3-4 minutes, lightly browning on all sides.
Step 7: Transfer the partially cooked chicken and onion mixture to an 8x8 inch baking dish.
Step 8: Pour the heavy cream over the chicken and sprinkle with fresh cilantro (if using).
Step 9: Cover the baking dish and bake for 25 minutes. Then, uncover and bake for another 5 minutes, or until the chicken is golden brown and cooked through.
Step 10: (Optional) For a richer flavor, broil the butter chicken for 1-2 minutes before serving.
Step 11: Serve hot with rice or naan bread.

recipes.name: Shredded Tandoori Chicken Tacos
ingredients: 1 1/2 pounds boneless, skinless organic chicken breasts
1 teaspoon Kashmiri red chili powder (substitute: paprika)
1 tablespoon tandoori masala (no food color, no salt)
1 teaspoon Kashmiri red chili powder (substitute: paprika)
1/4 teaspoon Indian red chili powder (substitute: cayenne pepper)
directions: 1. Make slits in the chicken breasts and massage with avocado oil, salt, turmeric powder, Kashmiri red chili powder, and lemon juice.
2. Blend together Greek yogurt, ginger, garlic, and tandoori masala. Add this mixture to the chicken, massage well, cover, and refrigerate for at least 4 hours, or preferably overnight.
3. Prepare the tandoori spice mix by blending cloves, fennel seeds, cinnamon stick, Kashmiri red chili powder, cumin seeds, coriander powder, green cardamom, and black cardamom in a coffee grinder.
4. Chop the red onion and bell peppers.
5. Set the Instant Pot to SAUTE mode. Once hot, add avocado oil and a black cardamom. Cook for 20 seconds.
6. Add the chopped onions and cook for 5 minutes.
7. Add the chopped bell peppers, season with salt, and cook for another 5 minutes.
8. Add the prepared tandoori spice mix and 2 tablespoons of water to the pot. Stir and press CANCEL.
9. Cut the chicken breasts in half and add them to the pot.
10. Close the Instant Pot lid, set the pressure release valve to "Sealing," and cook on HIGH PRESSURE for 10 minutes, followed by a 20-minute natural pressure release.
11. Once the pressure has released, open the Instant Pot and shred the chicken using two forks.
12. Return the shredded chicken to the pot and season with Indian red chili powder, dry fenugreek leaves, and chat masala. Stir.

13. To prepare the yogurt sauce, blend together sour cream (or Greek yogurt), serrano chili, garlic, salt, cilantro, lemon juice, vinegar, cumin powder, and garam masala in a food processor until smooth. Add a little water if needed to thin the sauce.
14. To assemble the tacos, fill gluten-free corn tortillas (or tortillas of your choice) with shredded purple or green cabbage, shredded chicken, and top with the yogurt sauce.

recipes.name: Indian Chicken in Yogurt Sauce
directions: Step 1: Heat the oil in a heavy-bottomed pot or pan. Add the bay leaves, green cardamom pods, cinnamon sticks, peppercorns, and mace. Sauté for 1 minute on low heat.
Step 2: Add the sliced onions and sauté for 5 minutes, or until golden brown.
Step 3: In a blender or mortar and pestle, combine the chilies, mint leaves, garlic, and ginger to form a smooth paste.
Step 4: Add the paste to the pot along with the garam masala, coriander powder, and some of the chopped coriander leaves. Cook for 2 minutes, stirring constantly.
Step 5: Add the chicken pieces and stir well to coat them in the spice mixture.
Step 6: Add the chopped potatoes and stir again.
Step 7: After 3-4 minutes, add the thick yogurt and stir until well combined.
Step 8: Add the water and salt. Bring the mixture to a simmer, then cover the pot with a lid and cook over medium heat for 8-10 minutes, stirring occasionally to prevent sticking.
Step 9: Check if the chicken and potatoes are cooked through. If so, the Indian Chicken in Yogurt Sauce is ready. Garnish with the remaining coriander leaves and serve hot with roti or rice.

1 teaspoon white vinegar or lime juice
2 tablespoons chopped spring onions or cilantro, for garnish
directions: Step 1: Marinate the chicken: In a bowl, combine the cubed chicken, ginger-garlic paste, Kashmiri chili powder, soy sauce, and black pepper powder. Mix well and let it marinate for at least 30 minutes.
Step 2: Prepare the batter: In a separate bowl, whisk together the all-purpose flour, cornstarch, and salt. Gradually add water until a thick batter is formed (similar to a pakora batter).

Step 3: Fry the chicken: Heat oil in a deep pan or wok over medium-high heat. Dip each marinated chicken piece into the batter, ensuring it's fully coated. Carefully drop the battered chicken into the hot oil and fry until golden brown and crispy, about 5-7 minutes. Remove and drain on paper towels.

Step 4: Sauté aromatics: In a large pan or wok, heat 1 tablespoon of oil over medium heat. Add the diced onions, minced garlic, grated ginger, and slit green chilies. Sauté until the onions become translucent, about 3-5 minutes.
Step 5: Make the sauce: Add the soy sauce, vinegar (or lime juice), and tomato ketchup to the pan. Sauté for another 2 minutes.

Step 6: Combine and simmer: Add the fried chicken pieces and diced bell pepper to the pan. Sprinkle a little water, cover, and cook on low heat for 4-5 minutes, or until the flavors meld and the chicken is heated through.

Step 7: Finish and serve: Uncover, mix gently, and adjust salt if needed. Remove from heat and garnish with chopped spring onions or cilantro. Serve hot as an appetizer or as a side dish with fried rice or noodles.

recipes.name: Nourishing Slow Cooker Chicken and Kale Soup
ingredients: 2 lbs bone-in, skinless chicken thighs (about 5 thighs)
1 lb carrots, peeled, halved lengthwise, and sliced into 1/4" thick pieces
1/2 bunch kale (about 4 cups packed), stems removed and chopped
Sea salt and black pepper, to taste
directions: Step 1: Place the chicken thighs in the base of a slow cooker. Season with 3/4 tbsp sea salt and 1/4 tsp black pepper.
Step 2: Add the thyme sprigs and minced garlic on top of the chicken.
Step 3: Pour in the water (or chicken broth). If using water, add the chicken base.
Step 4: Cook on high for 4 hours, or until the chicken is fall-off-the-bone tender.
Step 5: Remove the chicken from the slow cooker and set aside in a bowl. Discard the thyme sprigs.
Step 6: (Optional) Strain the broth through a fine-mesh sieve to remove any debris.
Step 7: Return the broth to the slow cooker and turn the heat back to high.
Step 8: Remove the chicken from the bones and lightly shred. Discard any cartilage. Return the bones to the soup.
Step 9: Add the carrots, diced onion, and chopped thyme to the broth. Cover and cook on high for 2 hours.
Step 10: Add the chopped kale during the last 30 minutes of cooking.
Step 11: Discard the bones and check the seasonings, adding more salt and pepper to taste.
Step 12: Return the shredded chicken to the soup and allow to reheat for about 10 minutes. Do not over-stir.
Step 13: Serve hot.

recipes.name: Indian-Spiced Chicken Thighs
ingredients: 1-inch piece fresh ginger, peeled and finely grated
directions: Step 1: Heat vegetable oil in a large skillet over high heat.
Step 2: Season chicken thighs with salt and pepper. Add chicken to the hot skillet and brown on both sides, cooking in batches if necessary. Remove chicken from skillet and set aside.
Step 3: Add chopped onion, minced garlic, grated ginger, and slit green chile to the skillet. Sauté for 3-5 minutes, or until softened.
Step 4: Add ground cumin, cayenne pepper, and garam masala to the skillet. Cook for 30 seconds, stirring constantly.
Step 5: Pour in pureed tomatoes and water. Stir well. Return chicken to the skillet.
Step 6: Bring the mixture to a simmer, then cover and cook for 30 minutes, or until chicken is cooked through and the sauce has thickened. Turn chicken occasionally during cooking.
Step 7: Uncover the skillet and stir in heavy cream. Simmer for 1 minute.
Step 8: Serve hot.

recipes.name: Indian-Spiced Chicken with Tomato and Cream
ingredients: 3 tablespoons ghee (clarified butter) or vegetable oil
6 chicken legs (drumsticks with thighs; about 3 lbs)
Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper, to taste
1 pound small Yukon Gold potatoes, sliced 1/4" thick
Naan, flatbread, or cooked rice, for serving
directions: Step 1: Heat the ghee or vegetable oil in a large Dutch oven over medium heat. Season the chicken legs with salt and pepper. Working in batches, cook the chicken skin-side down until golden brown (do not turn), 8-10 minutes per batch. Transfer the chicken to a plate.
Step 2: Add the chopped onion, grated garlic, and grated ginger to the pot. Cook, stirring occasionally, until the onion is very soft and golden brown, 8-10 minutes.
Step 3: Add the tomato paste, garam masala, cumin, turmeric, coriander, cayenne pepper, and cardamom to the pot. Cook, stirring often, until the tomato paste is beginning to darken, about 4 minutes.

Step 4: Return the chicken to the pot. Add the chicken broth, tomato purée, and heavy cream. Season with salt and pepper. Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer, partially covered, skimming occasionally, until the chicken is almost falling off the bone and the liquid is slightly thickened, 1 1/2 - 2 hours.

Step 5: Add the sliced potatoes to the pot. Cook, partially covered, until the potatoes are fork-tender, the chicken is falling off the bone, and the liquid is thick enough to coat a spoon, 30-45 minutes. Remove the skin and bones from the chicken, if desired, and return the meat to the pot. Season the stew with salt and pepper.
Step 6: Divide the stew among bowls. Top with plain yogurt and fresh mint. Serve with naan, flatbread, or rice.

recipes.name: Indian Tandoori Chicken
ingredients: 2 lbs boneless, skinless chicken thighs, cut into 2-inch pieces
1 tsp cayenne pepper (or less, to taste)
1 lemon, cut into wedges, for garnish
directions: Step 1: In a shallow dish, place the chicken pieces. Sprinkle salt and lemon juice over both sides of the chicken. Set aside for 20 minutes to marinate.

Step 2: In a medium bowl, whisk together the yogurt, chopped onion, minced garlic, grated ginger, garam masala, and cayenne pepper. If using, stir in the food coloring until the mixture is evenly colored.
Step 3: Spread the yogurt mixture evenly over the chicken pieces, ensuring they are well coated. Cover the dish and refrigerate for at least 6 hours, or preferably 24 hours, for the flavors to meld.
Step 4: Preheat an outdoor grill to medium-high heat or preheat your oven's broiler. Lightly oil the grill grates or a baking sheet.

Step 5: Grill the chicken for 5-7 minutes per side, or until cooked through and no longer pink inside. Alternatively, broil the chicken for a similar time, flipping halfway through. The internal temperature should reach 165°F (74°C).
Step 6: Garnish with fresh cilantro and lemon wedges before serving.

Soft, directional light emphasizes texture, creating deep shadows. Incorporate a blackened cast-iron skillet and warm-toned linen napkins for a rustic, inviting mood.

recipes.name: Trinidad Stewed Chicken
ingredients: 1 bunch fresh culantro, chopped (or 2 bunches cilantro)
directions: Step 1: Prepare the green seasoning: Combine chives, Spanish thyme, French thyme, culantro (or cilantro), pimento peppers, and celery in a blender or food processor. Process until finely chopped, adding a minimal amount of water if needed.

Step 2: Season the chicken: In a bowl, combine the chicken pieces with the green seasoning, Angostura bitters (if using), salt, and black pepper. Marinate in the refrigerator for at least 30 minutes, or longer if time permits.

Step 3: Caramelize the sugar and garlic: Heat the oil in a large, heavy-bottomed pot over medium heat. Add the brown sugar and minced garlic. Cook, stirring occasionally, until the sugar melts and caramelizes to a deep reddish-brown color. Be careful not to burn the garlic.

Step 4: Brown the chicken: Add the marinated chicken to the pot. Do not stir immediately. Allow the chicken to brown on one side, then turn and brown the other side. Repeat this process until the chicken is browned on all sides.

Step 5: Simmer the chicken: Add the Worcestershire sauce (if using), Maggi cube, and 2 cups of water (or chicken broth) to the pot. Add the hot pepper sauce (if using). Bring the liquid to a boil, then reduce the heat to medium-low, partially cover the pot, and simmer until the chicken is cooked through and tender, about 45-60 minutes.  Add more water if the liquid dries out too quickly.

Step 6: Reduce the sauce (optional): Once the chicken is cooked, if desired, remove the lid and increase the heat to medium. Cook until the sauce thickens to your desired consistency. If using pumpkin, add it during the last 15 minutes of cooking.
Step 7: Serve: Serve the stewed chicken hot with rice, salad, or vegetables.

Deeply browned chicken pieces glisten with sauce, nestled amongst vibrant green scallions. Soft, diffused lighting highlights the rich mahogany color of the sauce and the textures of the chicken. For a thicker sauce, add pumpkin cubes during the last 15 minutes of cooking.

recipes.name: Indian Butter Chicken (Murgh Makhani)
ingredients: 1 (3-inch) piece ginger, peeled and thinly sliced
1 (3-4 pound) whole chicken, cut into 8 pieces, skin removed
4 tablespoons unsalted butter, cut into 1/2-inch cubes
Freshly ground black pepper, to taste
directions: Step 1: Marinate the Chicken: In a food processor or blender, combine the Greek yogurt, lemon juice, 1 tablespoon of canola oil, 2 teaspoons of garam masala, red pepper flakes, 4 cloves of minced garlic, sliced ginger, and salt. Purée until smooth. Transfer the marinade to a large bowl and add the chicken pieces, tossing to coat thoroughly. Cover the bowl with plastic wrap and refrigerate for at least 4 hours, or preferably overnight.
recipes.image_prompt: Capture a vibrant, overhead close-up shot of Indian Butter Chicken (Murgh Makhani) in a shallow, dark grey bowl, garnished with fresh cilantro sprigs.  Use soft, directional lighting to highlight the rich, creamy texture and deep red-orange hue of the sauce, clinging to tender chicken pieces.  A shallow depth of field focuses sharply on the chicken in the foreground, blurring the sauce slightly towards the edges. Incorporate a rustic wooden background and a linen napkin for a warm, inviting mood, suggesting a home-cooked meal.

video_script.title: Indian Butter Chicken (Murgh Makhani)
video_script.description: Learn how to make creamy and flavorful Indian Butter Chicken at home! This recipe breaks down the steps to create a delicious, restaurant-quality dish.

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up shot of a finished plate of Indian Butter Chicken, garnished with fresh cilantro, served with rice and naan bread. Focus on the creamy texture and vibrant orange color of the dish.
scenes.voice_over: Welcome! Today, we're making classic Indian Butter Chicken, a dish known for its rich, creamy tomato-based sauce and tender chicken. Get ready for a flavor explosion!

scenes.image_prompt: Grouped ingredients shot: Greek yogurt, lemon, canola oil, garam masala, red pepper flakes, garlic, ginger, salt.  Arrange on a wooden surface with a warm light.
scenes.voice_over: Let’s gather our ingredients for the marinade: Greek yogurt, lemon juice, canola oil, garam masala, red pepper flakes, garlic, ginger, and salt.

scenes.image_prompt: Show chicken pieces being coated in the marinade in a bowl, then the bowl being covered and placed in a refrigerator.  Focus on even coating of the marinade.
scenes.voice_over: Blend these ingredients until smooth.  Add your chicken pieces to the marinade, ensuring they’re thoroughly coated. Cover and refrigerate for at least 4 hours, preferably overnight. This allows the flavors to meld beautifully.

scenes.image_prompt: Grouped ingredients shot: chicken, garlic, cardamom pods, cloves, canned tomatoes, ginger, bay leaf.  Arrange on a wooden surface next to a hot pan.
scenes.voice_over: Now for the sauce: minced garlic, cardamom pods, cloves, canned tomatoes, grated ginger, and a bay leaf.  We'll use these aromatics to build incredible depth of flavor.

scenes.image_prompt: Show the cooking process: garlic, ginger, spices being sautéed in a pan, then tomatoes added.  Steam should be slightly visible.
scenes.voice_over: Sauté the garlic and ginger in canola oil until fragrant. Then, add the cardamom pods, cloves, and bay leaf.  Next, add the tomatoes and simmer for about 20-25 minutes, until the sauce thickens.

scenes.image_prompt: Show the blending process: the tomato mixture being puréed in a blender until smooth.
scenes.voice_over: Once simmered, carefully transfer the tomato mixture to a blender and blend until smooth. This creates a velvety texture for our sauce.

scenes.image_prompt: Show the final cooking steps:  the blended sauce simmering in the pan, chicken being added, cream and butter incorporated.  Focus on rich color.
scenes.voice_over: Return the blended sauce to the pan. Add the marinated chicken and simmer until cooked through, about 15-20 minutes. Stir in heavy cream, butter, and garam masala.  This adds a luxurious richness and aroma.

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up shot of a finished plate of Indian Butter Chicken, garnished with fresh cilantro.  Mango chutney and raita are served alongside. Steam should be visible from the butter chicken.
scenes.voice_over: Garnish with fresh curry leaves. Serve hot with raita, mango chutney, and your choice of rice or naan bread. Enjoy your homemade Indian Butter Chicken!

cooking_tips: For a richer flavor, use full-fat Greek yogurt.
If you don't have fresh curry leaves, you can substitute with a pinch of dried curry leaves or omit them altogether.
Adjust the amount of red pepper flakes to control the spiciness of the dish.
Serve with basmati rice or naan bread for a complete meal.
